title.rendered: Israel Aid and Humanitarian Efforts in Gaza: August 12, 2024

content.rendered:
Aid Trucks Entry

Yesterday, 194 trucks carrying humanitarian goods were transferred to Gaza via the Kerem Shalom (166 trucks) and Erez (28 trucks) crossings.

Aid Collection

About 575 trucks are waiting for collection on the Gazan side of Kerem Shalom (August 11).

Fuel Supplies

6 tankers of fuel and 6 tankers of cooking gas designated for the operation of vital humanitarian infrastructure entered Gaza yesterday.

Route 96 Coordination

18 trucks carrying supplies for the construction of an additional MSF field hospital were coordinated via Route 96 yesterday.

Aid to Northern Gaza

28 aid trucks, as well as 1 gas tanker, were coordinated to northern Gaza yesterday.

Bakeries in Operation

13 bakeries are operational (7 in northern Gaza and 6 in central Gaza), producing close to 3 million pita loaves a day.

Medical Aid Efforts

We continuously facilitate large quantities of medical equipment and other aid requiring unique delivery conditions. Yesterday, a truck carrying insulin, vaccines, and other medicines was transferred to Gaza while ensuring a cold chain. We will continue expanding our efforts to facilitate humanitarian and medical responses for the Gaza Strip.

Coordination Requests

Out of 43 general coordination requests, 41 (95%) were approved. Additionally, 14 out of 15 (93%) of coordination requests to the north were approved, and out of 19 UN requests, 18 (95%) were approved (August 11).

Local Tactical Pause

Today, (August 12) between 10:00 and 14:00, the IDF will pause operations in the Al Attah North West Neighborhood in Beit Lahya to enable the movement of humanitarian aid.

excerpt.rendered: 194 aid trucks delivered to Gaza, fueling humanitarian efforts.
